Package FrontEnd

Class ShopApp

java.lang.Object
FrontEnd.ShopApp
public class ShopApp
extends java.lang.Object
Exercise 1 Code
Since:
Oct 9th, 2020 Sources: Code requirements from assignment Description: FrontEnd user interface. Handles all interactions with uses. Auto Generates an order if check quantity or decrease item reads a qty less than 40 as required by assignment details
Version:
1.0
Author:
Nathan Jack

    • printMenuChoices

      private void printMenuChoices()

    • sanitizeInput

      private java.lang.String sanitizeInput​(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String menu)
      Sanitizes user inputs for type. Accepts a string input. If input is numerical ensures value is 0 or greater. If menu flag is selected ensures input falls between 1-7.
      Parameters:
      s - user input string
      menu - flag for if input is for menu options.
      Returns:
      returns the string if input is a string. returns null if input does not fall within integer requirements.

    • setSupplierList

      private void setSupplierList​(java.util.LinkedHashSet<Supplier> sList)
      Initializes supplier list
      Parameters:
      sList - LinkedHashSet of Supplier items

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • generateOrder

      private boolean generateOrder​(java.lang.String input)
      Generates Order object from input item name/ID if item has not been ordered today.
      Parameters:
      Input - tool name or ID
      Returns:
      Returns true if item was added to list. Returns false if item has already been ordered today.

    • printOrderList

      private void printOrderList()
      Prints current order list.

    • addToOrderList

      private void addToOrderList​(int orderID, Order order)
      Adds Order to shop orderlist.
      Parameters:
      orderID - Unique hash ID Integer generated from tool ID
      order - Order object

    • inOrderList

      private boolean inOrderList​(java.lang.String input)
      Checks if tool has been ordered today and is in the list. Allows for tools to be ordered if days are different.
      Parameters:
      input - input tool ID or name
      Returns:
      returns true if item is in list. False otherwise
